intro: Chenopodium standleyanum, commonly known as the slender goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seed capsules contain tiny, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its ability to spread in various environments. Chenopodium standleyanum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in warm, humid conditions.
